job description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Kforce is looking for a Data Scientist for a client in the Seattle, WA area to help use analytic insights to drive feature development across multiple cross-functional teams.

Summary:
Are you interested in driving a data-first culture? Are you a Data Scientist with Engineering chops or an Engineer with Data Science chops? Are you interested in using data to drive feature level product decisions? Do you want to work with passionate Developers, Product Owners and Department Directors to deliver end-to-end features? If this sounds like you, please apply today!

Essential Functions:
  • Deliver full end-to-end product solutions: conduct requirement gathering, model development, end-to-end analysis and presentation of a/b testing results
  • Develop machine learning solutions to drive business value
  • Solve difficult, ambiguous analysis problems and work with large, complex data sets
  • Potential areas you could be working on: at scale recommender systems, real-time fraud detection systems, advertising optimizations, user join/retention programs
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline; Advanced degree highly preferred but not required
  • At least 4+ years of experience in a similar data scientist role
  • Coding skills (such as Python, Java, or Scala)
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Julia, pandas)
  • Experience with database languages (e.g., SQL, HIVE, NoSQL)
  • Applied experience with machine learning on large datasets
  • Experience translating analysis results into business recommendations
  • Ability to embed on a specific project to help deliver end-to-end solutions
Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
